covid19tracker 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Get started

Explore the case situation of COVID19 via Shiny Application in three countries

covid19tracker.Rmd

This covid19tracker package provides some function and cleaned data for describing how an Shiny web application could be launched interactively, and giving the visualization about the COVID19 case situation.

Loading package

The covid19tracker package can be installed directly from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("eetc5523-2020/r-package-assessment-xhee0013")

# load the package
library(covid19tracker)

Loading the data sets

This package also contains the following data sets:

  • covid19_count: This data set displays the monthly coronavirus cases in each country with each region in each country
  • covid19_region: This data set shows the cumulative COVID19 confirmed cases for each region in three countries.
covid19_count
covid19_region

Main function

The main functions in this package includes:

  • summary_table: This function create a styled and formatted table to represent the summary case situation of COVID19 in each country.
summary_table("China")
summary statistic
Month Country Confirmed Death Recovered
1 China 9802 213 214
2 China 69554 2624 39106
3 China 2923 472 36886
4 China 1677 1328 2317
5 China 190 1 866
6 China 639 3 243
7 China 2870 20 1155
8 China 2259 62 3807
9 China 321 13 535
  • input_option: This function provides the shiny input options for the different variables which are contained in the data sets.
input_option("country", covid19_count)

Launching the Shiny App

When downloading the package,the shiny app can be launched using the following launch_app function.

launch_app()

The main motivation of this simple shiny app is designed to interactively visualize the situation of COVID-19 cases in three countries such as Australia, China and United Kingdom from January to September and provide a platform for performing and reviewing the change of cases distribution for each regions in all countries across time. All data used by this application are collected through coronaviruspackage which is from RamiKrispin GitHub repo.

Within the app, users can compare the total number of cases and deaths recorded by each of the states in the country using the three following data visualisations:

  1. A leaflet map displaying the confirmed case of COVID-19 in each region with its corresponding country.

  2. A time series line plotly graph showing the time series data about how the three type of COVID-19 cases such as confirmed, death and recovered distributed from January to September in each corresponding region.

  3. A pie plotly graph representing the proportion of each case type in different months in each specific region.

  4. A table recording the number of confirmed,death and recovered case in each country from January to September

Further comment

If you would like to contribute to the package or leave comments, please feel free to leave an issue on Github or send me an email via xhee0013@student.monash.edu
